se.cbb.jprime.math

Interface Continuous1DPD

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ProbabilityDistribution
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Continuous1DPDDependent
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GammaDistribution, NormalDistribution, UniformDistribution

    public interface Continuous1DPD
extends ProbabilityDistribution
    Interface for 1-D continuous probability distributions, i.e. acting on real numbers. Examples include the gamma and exponential distributions.

    "Continuous" is here used in the sense distinguishing it from discrete distributions. It is thus perfectly allowed to have an implementation which is piecewise continuous, e.g. resembling a histogram. We do, however, require that all implementations are defined for a single domain interval [a,b], (a,b], [a,b) or (a,b), where the bounds a<b may take on real numbers as well as negative and positive infinity.

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Method Detail

      • getPDF

        double getPDF(double x)
        Returns the probability density function f(x) for a specified value x.
        Parameters:
        x - the value where to evaluate density.
        Returns:
        the probability density, f(x).

      • getCDF

        double getCDF(double x)
        Returns cumulative density function F(x)=P(X<=x) for a specified value x.
        Parameters:
        x - the value where to evaluate the cumulative density.
        Returns:
        the cumulative density F(x).

      • getQuantile

        double getQuantile(double p)
        Returns the quantile function, i.e., the inverse of the CDF, F^{-1}(p), 0<=p<=1.
        Parameters:
        p - the probability.
        Returns:
        x so that F(x)=P(X<=x)=p.

      • getProbability

        double getProbability(double a,
                    double b)
        For specified values a<=b, returns the probability F(b)-F(a)=P(a<=X<=b).
        Parameters:
        a - the smaller boundary.
        b - the larger boundary.
        Returns:
        P(a<=X<=b).

      • getMean

        double getMean()
        Returns the mean, i.e. the expected value mu=E(X).
        Returns:
        the mean.

      • setMean

        void setMean(double mean)
        Sets the mean.
        Parameters:
        mean - the new mean.

      • getMedian

        double getMedian()
        Returns the median, i.e. the value m so that P(X<=m)=P(X>m)=1/2. Equivalent to getQuantile(0.5).
        Returns:
        the median.

      • getMode

        double getMode()
        Returns the mode. If there are multiple modes, may e.g. return one of them.
        Returns:
        the mode.

      • getStandardDeviation

        double getStandardDeviation()
        Returns the standard deviation sigma=sqrt(E((X-E(X))^2)).
        Returns:
        the standard deviation.

      • setStandardDeviation

        void setStandardDeviation(double stdev)
        Sets the standard deviation.
        Parameters:
        stdev - the new standard deviation.

      • getVariance

        double getVariance()
        Returns the variance sigma^2=E((X-E(X))^2).
        Returns:
        the variance.

      • setVariance

        void setVariance(double var)
        Sets the variance.
        Parameters:
        var - the new variance.

      • getCV

        double getCV()
        Returns the coefficient of variation, i.e. c_v=sigma/|mu|, where sigma is the standard deviation and mu the mean.
        Returns:
        the standard deviation.

      • getDomainInterval

        RealInterval getDomainInterval()
        Returns the domain interval, i.e. what is sometimes referred to as the support.
        Returns:
        the domain interval.

      • sampleValue

        double sampleValue(PRNG prng)
        Samples a value from the distribution.
        Parameters:
        prng - the pseudo-random number generator.
        Returns:
        the sample.
